s01.title: Learjet 45 Overview
s01.en: The Learjet 45 is a low-wing, twin engined business jet that is used as an advanced trainer. pree a.

s02.title: Fuselage Sections
s02.en: The fuselage comprises four main sections.

s03.title: Nose Section Layout
s03.en: EmEmmGGwmm-, The nose section consists of an equipment bay on the upper haif with the nose landing gear bay below.

s04.title: Fuel Section & MLG Bay
s04.title_tr: Yakıt Bölümü ve Ana İniş Takımı Yuvası
s04.en: The fuel section is behind the rear pressure bulkhead. This section consists of a fuselage fuel tank and the main landing gear bay.

s05.title: Tailcone Compartments
s05.en: Behind this is the tailcone section, which consists of a baggage compartment, an A-P-U or auxiliary power unit compartment, and a tailcone compartment. The tailcone compartment serves as another equipment bay. 1 1 a Po 1 -

s06.title: Main Entry Door
s06.en: Entry to the airplane is through the main entry door at the forward left side of the fuselage. The entry door is made up of the upper and the lower doors. Only the upper door is classified as an emergency exit. PE yy )

s07.title: Emergency Escape Hatch
s07.en: An emergency escape hatch is located at the rear right hand side of the passenger cabin. In an emergency, the hatch is removed from the airplane structure.

s08.title: Baggage & Tailcone Access
s08.en: Access to the baggage compartment is by a baggage door on the left hand side of the tailcone section. Access to the tailcone compartment is by a door on the right hand side of the tailcone section. Both the baggage and tailcone compartments are not pressurised. PE yy )

s09.title: Pilot Seats Location
s09.en: The two pilots seats are located in front of the entry door. PEE Pa. . . am Pon wr)

s10.title: Observer Seat & Cabinet
s10.en: Directly behind is an observer's seat. Next to the observer is an observer's cabinet. The cabinet houses two oxygen bottles for the fixed oxygen system and also for the aircraft manuals and documentation. IE J. . a . am oo. Pn wr.

s11.title: Passenger Seats & Escape Hatch
s11.en: Six passenger seats are fitted. The escape hatch is located on the right hand side of the cabin area. ae Ze a Py o am Py PR oe wy,

s12.title: Lavatory & Aft Baggage
s12.en: Behind the passenger area is a toilet and aft baggage compartment. This area can be enclosed by sliding doors within the compartment bulkheads. Lo a PE. . Py I. om Py oo. a. wy.

s13.title: Seat Adjustments (Crew)
s13.en: The pilots and observer's seats are identical. All seat adjustments are mechanical. Co J. . a . am oo. Pn wr.

s14.title: Vertical Seat Adjustment
s14.en: Lift the lever up to unlock the seat and allow it to be moved vertically. oo a Pa. . . am Pon wr)

s15.title: Backrest Angle
s15.en: The backrest angle is adjusted with a lever at the side of the seat.

s16.title: Armrest Adjustment
s16.en: The armrest angle is adjusted by an adjusting wheel under each armrest. To stow the armrest, raise it to the vertical position and then push it towards the seat back. oo J -

s17.title: Headrest Adjustment
s17.en: The headrest is adjustable for height as well as for angle. This is done by manually repositioning the headrest to the desired position.

s18.title: Lumbar & Harness Lock
s18.title_tr: Bel Desteği ve Emniyet Kemer Kilidi
s18.en: An adjusting wheel at the side of the seat back allows for lumbar adjustment. At the side of the seat back is a lever, which is used to lock or unlock the safety harness. 1 To IB )

s19.title: Lavatory Limitations
s19.en: The toilet is located at the right hand side of the aft compartment. The toilet seat is not rated for takeoff or landing and must not be occupied during these phases of flight. Note that there is no washbasin in the aircraft. J, Ze a Py o am Py PE Lo wy V1

s20.title: Aft Luggage Platform
s20.en: On the left side of the aft compartment is a luggage platform. A baggage net may be erected to prevent bags from sliding off the platform. a I Se am ES wy)

s21.title: Lavatory System Components
s21.en: The toilet assembly consists mainly of a waste reservoir and a flushing reservoir and associated pumps and valve. DE PE. I. . am Py PE . wr)

s22.title: Flush Pump Operation
s22.en: Whenever the toilet flush switch is operated, a flush pump will run for a pre-determined period of time. The flush pump draws water from the flushing reservoir to spray it around the toilet bowl before it collects in the waste reservoir. PEN

s23.title: External Servicing Panel
s23.en: The toilet assembly is serviced through an external servicing panel on the right hand side just below the right wing leading edge. Information on servicing will be found under the GROUND HANDLING module. Co oo J - ca J 4p

s24.title: Instrument Panel Layout
s24.en: This shows the instrument panel layout. Typical Instrument panel arrangement shown PE oo In a, a DE on a4

s25.title: Glare Shield & EFIS Controls
s25.en: At the top is the glare shield panel, which has controls for the auto flight guidance system or A-F-G-S. On either side of this are the controls for the E-F--S or Electronic Flight Instrument System. Outboard of these are the master warningcaution lights.

s26.title: Display Units & ECAS
s26.en: The main instrument panel has four screens, referred to as Display Units. The D-U one and the D-U four units are the or Primary Flight Displays. D-U two is known as E--C-A-S or Engine Indicating and Crew Alert System. D-U three is the or Muiti-function Display. ew aa 1 I Te am el ama ames

s27.title: Standby Instruments
s27.en: GmSGm At the center of the instrument panel are the three independent standby instruments, showing airspeed, attitude and altitude. a a ea am mmm

s28.title: CWP & RMU Overview
s28.en: Below the standby instruments is the Crew Warning Panel, which consists of warning lights. Two R-M-Us or Radio Management Units are located below the crew-warning panel. These are used mainly for communications system control.

s29.title: Systems Control Row
s29.en: Imm- The lower edge of the main instrument panel consists of controls for the various aircraft systems.

s30.title: Pedestal & Systems Controls
s30.en: Le The top of the control pedestal, apart from housing the thrust levers for the engines, also has controls for other aircraft systems. Circuit breaker panels, not shown here, are located on the pilot's sidewalls. a nem a a Py am Py ca a.

s31.title: Lesson Complete
s31.en: This completes the lesson on Airplane General. PEE PE. . Py I. om Py oo. a. wy.
